item.title: CISA warns of actively exploited Git code execution flaw
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The U.S. Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) is warning of hackers exploiting an arbitrary code execution flaw in the Git distributed version control system. [...]

item.title: Beyond GDPR security training: Turning regulation into opportunity
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Passwork
item.description: Discover how GDPR compliance can spark real growth and give you a competitive advantage with practical strategies and a strong security culture. [...]

item.title: Nissan confirms design studio data breach claimed by Qilin ransomware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Nissan Japan has confirmed to BleepingComputer that it suffered a data breach following unauthorized access to a server of one of its subsidiaries, Creative Box Inc. (CBI). [...]

item.title: Surge in coordinated scans targets Microsoft RDP auth servers
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Internet intelligence firm GreyNoise reports that it has recorded a significant spike in scanning activity consisting of nearly 1,971 IP addresses probing Microsoft Remote Desktop Web Access and RDP Web Client authentication portals in unison, suggesting a coordinated reconnaissance campaign. [...]

item.title: New AI attack hides data-theft prompts in downscaled images
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Researchers have developed a novel attack that steals user data by injecting malicious prompts in images processed by AI systems before delivering them to a large language model. [...]

item.title: Farmers Insurance data breach impacts 1.1M people after Salesforce attack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: U.S. insurance giant Farmers Insurance has disclosed a data breach impacting 1.1 million customers, with BleepingComputer learning that the data was stolen in the widespread Salesforce attacks. [...]

item.title: Auchan retailer data breach impacts hundreds of thousands of customers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: French retailer Auchan is informing that some sensitive data associated with loyalty accounts of several hundred thousand of its customers was exposed in a cyberattack. [...]

item.title: Malicious Android apps with 19M installs removed from Google Play
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Seventy-seven malicious Android apps containing different types of malware were found on Google Play after being downloaded more than 19 million times. [...]

item.title: Critical Docker Desktop flaw lets attackers hijack Windows hosts
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A critical vulnerability in Docker Desktop for Windows and macOS allows compromising the host by running a malicious container, even if the Enhanced Container Isolation (ECI) protection is active. [...]

item.title: Defending against malware persistence techniques with Wazuh
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Wazuh
item.description: Malware persistence keeps attackers in your systems long after reboots or resets. Wazuh helps detect and block hidden techniques like scheduled tasks, startup scripts, and modified system files—before they turn into long-term compromise. [...]

item.title: New Android malware poses as antivirus from Russian intelligence agency
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new Android malware posing as an antivirus tool software created by Russia's Federal Security Services agency (FSB) is being used to target executives of Russian businesses. [...]

item.title: FTC warns tech giants not to bow to foreign pressure on encryption
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) is warning major U.S. tech companies against yielding to foreign government demands that weaken data security, compromise encryption, or impose censorship on their platforms. [...]
